alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 11:54AM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Snowmelt due to warm temperatures and upstream dam releases will continue to result in increased river flows. For the Weber River...including Huntsville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet (992 CFS), low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 4.7 feet (near 1070 CFS) - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM MDT Wednesday was 4.9 feet (near 1160 CFS) - Forecast...The river is forecast to remain above flood stage until further notice. - Flood stage is 4.6 feet (992 cfs). &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Thursday at 1200 PM MDT.
